person.persName: Reuben May (Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Emariah Honaker May in Pike County, Kentucky, on March 5, 1835. Father of Julia Ann May, Louisa May, Mary May, William May, Thomas May, Zuinglieus May, James May, Isabella V. May, Robert D. May, Alonzo F. May, Albert B. May, Reuben R. May, and Hugh L. May. Resident of Pike County in 1840. Farmer in Clay County in 1850. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel from January 15, 1862 to May 6, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a colonel from May 13, 1863 to October 5, 1864. Wounded at the Battle of Stones River, Tennessee.
